Functions
createSceneBody
function createSceneBody(
radius,
height,
color
)

creates a "scene body", this is the THREE.js buffer representation of an orbital body like the moon, the sun or planets

Parameters
radius

radius of the body (used in x and z direction)

height

radius of the body along the y direction (used for making oblate spheroids)

color

color of this body

Returns

the THREE.js buffer representation of this orbital body

createBody
function createBody(
astronomy_body,
radius,
height,
color
)

creates a "body", this is the representation of an orbital body like the moon, the sun or planets as its geocentric orbit and its physical form (sphere)

Parameters
astronomy_body

reference to the astronomy.js instance of this body

radius

radius of the body (used in x and z direction)

height

radius of the body along the y direction (used for making oblate spheroids)

color

color of this body

fillSceneWithObjects
function fillSceneWithObjects(
scene
)

fills the scene with all objects other than satellites

Parameters
scene

the THREE.js scene object

updateSceneObjects
function updateSceneObjects(
delta
)

updates scene objects that have to be updated every frame gets called every frame in the rendering loop!

Parameters
delta

passed delta time since last frame in seconds

addBodyOrbit
function addBodyOrbit(
scene,
body,
color
)

creates the THREE.js representation of the given orbital body's orbit

Parameters
scene

the THREE.js scene object

body

reference to the astronomy.js instance of this body

color

color of this body

equatorialToEclipticPlane
function equatorialToEclipticPlane(
coordinates
)

transforms equatorial to ecliptic plane coordinates

Parameters
coordinates

the input coordinate in the quatorial coordinate system

Returns

the transformed coordinates in the ecliptic coordinate system

updateSceneObjectDateRelevantInfos
function updateSceneObjectDateRelevantInfos()

updates the date dependent code for the scene objects

continuousAstronomyCalculation
function continuousAstronomyCalculation()

continously updates the position of the orbital bodies updates about every second

astronomyCalculation
function astronomyCalculation()

updates the position of the orbital bodies
